statement:
Let $K$ be a number field, and let $\mathcal{O}_K$ be its ring of
integers. Then $$\mathcal{O}_K^*\cong \mu(K)\times\mathbb{Z}^{r+s-1}.$$
Here $\mathcal{O}_K^*$ is the group of units of $\mathcal{O}_K$,
$\mu(K)$ is the finite cyclic group of the roots of unity in
$\mathcal{O}_K^*$, $r$ is the number of real embeddings
$K\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$, and $2s$ is the number of non-real complex
embeddings $K\rightarrow \mathbb{C}$ (which occur in complex conjugate
pairs, so $s$ is an integer).
